title: Azure Databricks Administrator
description:
**Job Description:**

The Azure Databricks will be responsible for providing technical expertise in deploying applications on Azure Databricks platform.

**Essential Technical Experience :**

5+ years’ experience in Databricks administration

The Databricks Administrator must be self-motivated and apply knowledge of Azure to drive solutions, support the development team, and create documentation to support and describe technical solutions.

An ideal candidate will have deep technical Azure platform expertise and demonstrate high standards of accountability, customer focus, and quality.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Implement, setup, configure, monitor, and maintain various Microsoft Azure Databricks solutions including:

Databricks access control

Databricks Cost Management

Databricks Performance Management.

Azure Application Gateways

Databricks Backup (IaC based)

Azure virtual network Databricks Storage (DBFS)o Azure Storage (ADLS)

Databricks SQL – Delta Live Table

Disaster Recovery Deploy and maintain PaaS & SaaS Databricks platform for Machine Learning (ML) development, QA, staging, and production environments hosted on Azure cloud infrastructure.

Understanding of a multitude of Azure resources and services such as containers, virtual machines, storage, firewalls, network security groups, web application firewalls, vnets, log analytics, sentinel, azure monitor, alerting, metrics, Data Factory, Databricks, Azure AD, Data Catalog, Web Apps, Functions,

Application Service Environments, Key Vaults, Azure Backups. Manage Databricks environments in line with security guidelines.

Develop Infrastructure as Code(IaC) to automate databricks environment deployments.

Develop a library of scripts to automate databricks MLOps environments.Identify and generate solutions to current problems in the organization.

Aid developers and DevOps teams with implementing automation scripts that follow the company standards.

Collaborating with DevOps team members as well as all of engineering ensures that solutions exhibit high levels of performance, security, scalability, maintainability, appropriate reusability, and reliability upon deployment.

Partner with Cloud solution architect and development team to fully understand product requirements and configure the Databricks environments which meet these requirements.

Evaluate and automate the scaling and capacity requirements within Azure environments. Create custom scripts to automate support processes where applicable.

Manage Databricks infrastructure and collaborate with various teams to ensure it integrates seamlessly with all components including network, security, messaging, and remote access.

Troubleshoot and resolve Databricks environment performance issues, connectivity issues, security issues.

Research, adopt and relate new technologies to solve issues that arise while adhering to company security and standards.

Solid experience in the administration and performance tuning of Databricks is required for success at this position.

Working knowledge of Azure Active Directory, Snowflake and Azure Cloud components is a PLUS.

Solid scripting skills is required for success at this position.

Experience in working with formal Change Control Systems. Mentor, coach, and share knowledge with other team members throughout the organization.

Other duties as assigned.

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $65.00 - $70.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Azure Databricks: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Network Analyst II
description:
*Agile Defense provides leading-edge Digital Transformation solutions to support and advance our customers' mission. We deliver innovative and high-quality services to our customers worldwide through an empowered and engaged workforce.* **Requisition #:** 20 **Job Title:** Network Analyst II **Location:** Ashburn, VA **(Remote)** **Clearance Level:** Active CBP Suitability, DHS Suitability, Active TS **Salary Range:** $49,260 - $73,890
**SUMMARY**
Customs Border Patrol (CBP) has a global presence with connectivity to approximately 1300 field sites as well as Other Government Agencies (OGAs) and trade partners. CBP conducts operations in 22 countries, 328 ports of entry, 129 border patrol stations within 22 sectors, and 75 AMO locations. To support its mission, CBP needs a robust, resilient, and high performing enterprise network and supporting services throughout its global footprint. The Network Services Division within the Office of Information and Technology (OIT) Enterprise Infrastructure and Operations Directorate (EIOD) provides network services and oversight of the CBP enterprise network infrastructure and comprises the Network Architecture and Engineering Division (NAED) and Network Operations Division (NOD).
The Network Analyst II provides direct support to the Senior Mobility Engineer with Mobile Device Management (MDM) user support and issue resolution. Candidate should have working experience in supporting Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) and MDM solutions at large scale Enterprise customers with proven delivery in supporting, maintaining and troubleshooting “complex” AirWatch or equivalent MDM systems. The Network Analyst II (Mobility Support) supports the Solutions Architect with design and implementation tasks and address client queries over the phone and resolve mobile device related issues. **JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**
Provide system administration of Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) and Mobile Device management (MDM) solutions
Support, maintain and troubleshoot AirWatch systems
Support the design and implementation of simple MDM solutions
Support escalation and root cause analysis activities
Support of all updates to all documents when there is change in the transport design and/or technologies and collaborating with all stakeholders to test all related systems and processes to verify that the systems meet requirements and can host applications with no degradation to performance or security
Address client queries over the phone and resolve mobile device related issues
Work with the Solution Architect to implement solutions
Provide network administration support: firewalls, general network infrastructure and security fundamentals, VPN, DNS
Follow and perform ITIL Incident, problem and requirements management
Develop and implement test strategies and documents results
Provides documentation, guidance and training to end-users as needed
Receive mentoring for MDM Airwatch solutions design and implementation by solutions architect
Responsible for the preparation of test reports and Implementation Plans for each change impacting the Production environment **QUALIFICATIONS** **Required Certifications**
Eligibility/Clearance Requirements: Must be a U.S. Citizen with an active clearance.
Clearance Preference:
CBP Full BI - 1st priority
Any DHS badge + DoD Top Secret - 2nd choice
DoD Top Secret + willingness to get CBP clearance - 3rd choice (it can take 45 days to 6 months to obtain a CBP clearance – work can only begin once the clearance is fully adjudicated) **Education, Background, and Years of Experience**
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT Systems, or other related discipline. Education requirement may be substituted with an additional 4 years of relevant experience.
2-4 years’ work experience as a System Administrator – supporting, maintaining and troubleshooting MDM systems AND Smart Devices (Apple, Android devices like tablet and smart phone, Windows iOS, etc. **ADDITIONAL SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS** **Required Skills**
Experience with firewalls, VPN, DNS and general network and network security infrastructure
Strong understanding of servers & configuration & maintenance: Windows Server 2008 / 2003 / 2013, Exchange, 0365, Azure AD, Active Directory, Web server platforms (IIS, Apache), Linux Forms (Ubuntu, Fedora, RedHat, Photon, Open Suse), other mail systems, web certifications such as SSL and IIS
Strong knowledge of ITIL based Service Management workflow applications such as incident, problem, and requirements management: Authentication, Certificate system, etc.
Technical Certifications or demonstrable experience in in one or more MDM Products (AirWatch, MobileIron, XenMobile, Symantec MDM, Good Tech)
Seeking candidate who can mentor, teach and grow a small team from within to support growing customer requirements.
Must have great communication and documentation skills.
Must be able to work with minimal supervision and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. **WORKING CONDITIONS** **Environmental Conditions**
Fully Remote (Must be within a 4 hour driving distance from the NCR).  

  

**Strength Demands**
Medium – 50 lbs. Maximum lifting with frequent lift/carry up to 25 lbs. **Physical Requirements**
Stand or Sit; Walk; Repetitive Motion; Use Hands / Fingers to Handle or Feel; Stoop, Kneel, Crouch, or Crawl; See; Push or Pull; Climb (stairs, ladders) or Balance (ascend / descend, work atop, traverse).
*Employees of Agile Defense are our number one priority, and the importance we place on our culture here is fundamental. Our culture is alive and evolving, but it always stays true to its roots. Here, you are valued as a family member, and we believe that we can accomplish great things together. Agile Defense has been highly successful in the past few years due to our employees and the culture we create together. We believe several attributes are the root of our very best employees and extraordinary culture. We have named these attributes “The 6 H’s” – Happy, Helpful, Honest, Humble, Hungry, and Hustle.*  

***Happy****: We exhibit a positive outlook in order to create a positive environment.****Helpful****: We assist each other and pull together as teammates to deliver.****Honest****: We conduct our business with integrity.****Humble****: We recognize that success is not achieved alone, that there is always more to learn, and that no task is below us.****Hungry****: We desire to consistently improve.****Hustle****: We work hard and get after it.* *These Core Values are present in all our employees and our organization's aspects. Learn more about us and our culture by visiting us* *here.* ***COVID-19 Vaccination Requirements****Agile Defense is subject to federal vaccine mandates or other customer/facility vaccination requirements as a federal contractor. As such, to protect its employees' health and safety and comply with customer requirements, Agile Defense may require employees in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Vaccination requirements will depend on the status of the federal contractor mandate and customer site requirements.* **Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities**
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Solution Architect
description:
**Who is Blueprint?**



We are a technology solutions firm headquartered in Bellevue, Washington, with a strong presence across the United States. Unified by a shared passion for solving complicated problems, our people are our greatest asset. We use technology as a tool to bridge the gap between strategy and execution, powered by the knowledge, skills, and the expertise of our teams, who all have unique perspectives and years of experience across multiple industries. We're bold, smart, agile, and fun.


**What does Blueprint do?**



Blueprint helps organizations unlock value from existing assets by leveraging cutting-edge technology to create additional revenue streams and new lines of business. We connect strategy, business solutions, products, and services to transform and grow companies.


**Why Blueprint?**



At Blueprint, we believe in the power of possibility and are passionate about bringing it to life. Whether you join our bustling product division, our multifaceted services team or you want to grow your career in human resources, your ability to make an impact is amplified when you join one of our teams. You'll focus on solving unique business problems while gaining hands-on experience with the world's best technology. We believe in unique perspectives and build teams of people with diverse skillsets and backgrounds. At Blueprint, you'll have the opportunity to work with multiple clients and teams, such as data science and product development, all while learning, growing, and developing new solutions. We guarantee you won't find a better place to work and thrive than at Blueprint.s



We are looking for a **Solutions Architect** to join us as we build cutting-edge technology solutions! Our team is looking for a talented engineering/architect leader with a strong background in building robust and scalable solutions across various domains including data warehousing, ETL, big data/analytics, data science, and cloud platforms, specifically Azure and Databricks. This role is responsible for conducting architectural design sessions, leading project implementation, and driving the creation of MVP's or Proof of Concept (PoC's). The ideal candidate will have experience building and leading data engineering teams in a dynamic, fast-paced business environment.


**Responsibilities**:


* Serve as the Primary Architecture-Engagement-Lead with a focus on Azure and Databricks.
* Define processes, standards, and guidelines for architecting data platforms, Data Estates, and modern ELT/ETL, Compute, Storage, Consumption for BI, and Data Science workloads on Azure.
* Support delivery teams as a senior technical leader in a hands-on capacity to remove blockers, create demos, proofs of concepts, and troubleshoot solutions with other engineers.
* Coach clients in adopting technology to solve their core business needs and issues relating to data, BI, data science, and analytics services on Azure.
* Be the go-to resource for our clients through increasing your knowledge and approach with new and existing technologies on Azure and Databricks.
* Lead collaboration with both internal and external stakeholders.
* Quickly understand client's business needs, make impactful recommendations, and adjust accordingly to needs as they change.
* Define architecture roadmaps with the ability to design a phased approach to completion while considering pre-existing, legacy challenges on Azure and Databricks.
* Demonstrated experience in cloud architecture and technologies, specifically on Azure.
* Aid in defining the scope of work and drafting proposals and contracts sent to clients for new business.
* Build and maintain Blueprint's lab/demo environment, with working demonstrations on data estate patterns and concepts, e.g., Azure, Databricks, ELT, Streaming, BI, and Data Analytics.


**Qualifications:**


* 5+ years of experience in the design and implementation of large-scale data platforms/solutions using Microsoft Azure.
* Expert knowledge of Azure services with a focus on Modern Data Solutions and Frameworks, adapters/connectors, and orchestration components.
* Experience with Databricks or other Azure data services and associated languages such as Python, SQL, etc.
* Demonstrated experience in designing and building cloud and hybrid solutions that run on Azure, including: (Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Virtual Network, Azure Storage, Azure Monitoring, Azure Security).
* Expert knowledge of Azure services: (Azure DevOps, Azure Storage, Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Functions, API Management, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Identity and Access Management, Azure Data Factory).
* 5+ years of experience in SQL, data transformations, migration, statistical analysis, and troubleshooting across more than one Database Platform (Azure SQL Database, PostgreSQL, Databricks, SQL).
* Work experience in a Software development team leveraging agile tools like Azure DevOps, Jira, Confluence, GitHub, GitHub Actions, Slack, etc.
* 5+ Years' experience with Enterprise data warehousing, ETL, and BI services.
* 3+ Years' experience in Cloud data and modern data management patterns supporting data warehousing and data lake architectures on Azure.
* Understanding and appreciation of modern data platforms and integration services.
* Understanding and appreciation for modern approaches and platforms for data quality, data governance, and cataloging services, CDC, append-only, streaming, incremental data acquisition, and data mart/fact-dimension design techniques.
* Proven ability to build and manage executive-level client relationships.
* Strong communicator with an evidence-based mindset to developing customer experience.
* Goal and results-focused, with a mindset of delivering customer value; with a focus on speed-to-value in all activities.
* Proactive self-starter who can thrive in flat organizations and ambiguous situations.


**Salary Range**



Pay ranges vary based on multiple factors including, without limitation, skill sets, education, responsibilities, experience, and geographical market. The pay range for this position reflects geographic based ranges for Washington state: $160,700 to $200,000 USD/annually. The salary/wage and job title for this opening will be based on the selected candidate's qualifications and experience and may be outside this range.


**Equal Opportunity Employer**



Blueprint Technologies, LLC is an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, color, age, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, orientation, veteran/military status, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital, or familial status, genetic information, citizenship, or any other status protected by law.



If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process, please reach out to: recruiting@bpcs.com



Blueprint believe in the importance of a healthy and happy team, which is why our comprehensive benefits package includes:


* Medical, dental, and vision coverage
* Flexible Spending Account
* 401k program
* Competitive PTO offerings
* Parental Leave
* Opportunities for professional growth and development


**Location:** Remote

title: Regional Network Architect (Remote)
description:
**About AESC US LLC**

**AESC** is an exciting, newly created global organization committed to solving the challenges of a sustainable future and becoming the leading supplier of full-value-chain battery solutions. Our lithium-ion batteries can be found in more than Nine Hundred Thousand electric vehicles worldwide and have a stellar safety record of zero-critical issues. AESC US is leading the way in battery technology. We design and manufacture EV battery technology for various electric vehicles and equipment. We are working hard towards unlocking the full potential of sustainable energy and climate change mitigation. We will continue to build upon our successes and expand into new markets and industries, producing innovative and competitive products and technologies that advance the goal of a zero-carbon emission future. AESC is headquartered in Japan and has battery manufacturing locations in Japan, UK, China, and the U.S. We are currently seeking candidates to fill a **Regional** **Network Architect,**role to support our U.S. Based facilities. This is a wonderful opportunity for the right candidate to gain valuable experience and contribute to a growing company.

***This position is a remote position.***

**Job Summary**


As a seasoned Network Architect for our regional operations, you will serve as a linchpin in our global IT infrastructure COE, bringing your extensive experience to design, implement, and manage complex network systems. In this pivotal role, you will be the authority on creating robust, secure, and scalable network architectures, delivering Tier 3 support, and ensuring seamless integration with our global network practices. Your knowledge of manufacturing-specific network requirements, particularly in the automotive sector, will be vital in driving our network strategy forward. You will lead efforts to standardize and document network processes, fostering cross-regional coherence and upholding our commitment to excellence. Combining technical acumen with strategic oversight, you will enhance our network capabilities and provide the leadership needed to maintain our competitive edge in a dynamic, interconnected environment.

**Job Functions**

*The following job function statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of this* *position.*

 **Key Responsibilities:**

**Network Architecture and Design:**

* Develop comprehensive network designs that address both current and future organizational needs, considering factors like scalability, security, and redundancy. Manufacturing experience a PLUS.
* Lead the transformation and modernization of the regional network architecture to ensure alignment with global infrastructure and industry best practices.
* Collaborate with cybersecurity teams to ensure that network designs adhere to stringent security protocols and standards.

 **Tier 3 Support:**

* Provide hands-on technical expertise for the most complex network issues, ensuring minimal downtime and rapid resolution.
* Develop and maintain documentation on regional network issues, solutions, and configurations to ensure faster resolutions in the future.
* Collaborate with tier 1 and tier 2 support teams, offering guidance, and ensuring they are equipped with the necessary tools and knowledge.

 **Collaboration and Consultation:**

* Lead discussions with business units to understand their specific network needs and translate those into technical requirements.
* Work closely with vendors, evaluating and recommending network products and solutions that align with the company’s objectives.

 **Management and Leadership:**

* Oversee regional network projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within scope, and within budget.
* Foster an environment of continuous learning, encouraging team members to stay updated with the latest in network technologies and methodologies.
* Conduct regular review meetings with internal teams to ensure alignment and address any challenges promptly.

 **Continuous Improvement:**

* Lead initiatives to optimize and upgrade the network infrastructure, ensuring the organization remains at the forefront of technology adoption.
* Regularly review and analyze network performance metrics, identifying areas of improvement and implementing solutions.

 **Documentation and Standardization Development:**

* Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for regional network architectures, configurations, standards, and procedures.
* Lead the creation of a centralized knowledge repository that is accessible to global teams, ensuring that documentation is up-to-date, accurate, and effectively structured.
* Champion the development and continuous refinement of network standards and best practices to be adopted across the organization.
* Facilitate cross-regional collaboration to ensure network design and documentation consistency, aiding in swift and precise issue resolution.
* Implement documentation version control and review processes to keep pace with network changes and updates.
* Coordinate with global IT teams to align regional documentation with global network strategies and ensure standardization across all platforms and projects.

 **Qualifications and Skills:**

* Documentation and Standardization Development:
* Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for regional network architectures, configurations, standards, and procedures.
* Lead the creation of a centralized knowledge repository that is accessible to global teams, ensuring that documentation is up-to-date, accurate, and effectively structured.
* Champion the development and continuous refinement of network standards and best practices to be adopted across the organization.
* Facilitate cross-regional collaboration to ensure network design and documentation consistency, aiding in swift and precise issue resolution.
* Implement documentation version control and review processes to keep pace with network changes and updates.
* Coordinate with global IT teams to align regional documentation with global network strategies and ensure standardization across all platforms and projects.
* Excellent project management skills.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.

title: Network Architect (DoD)
description:
Based in Washington D.C. Metro area, Pivot Path Solutions, LLC is a government contracting and management consulting firm that offers enterprise IT solutions, strategic planning, organizational development, and business transformation services to help customers adapt and thrive in changing market conditions. We bring passion, sincerity and integrity to every product and service we provide to our customers. Pivot Path Solutions is currently seeking a talented **Network Architect** to join our team. This is a remote position, however candidates are preferred based in Washington D.C. Metro area.  

  

**Project Description:**  

This initiative is designed to support the Information Technology mission of the Defense Health Agency (DHA). The program will deliver a range of services encompassing Cybersecurity, Information Systems Operations, Desktop Support, Mobile Technology Services, Infrastructure Services, Information Systems Development and Modernization, as well as Web Services Development, Management, and Support.  

  

**Key Roles/Responsibilities:*** **System Administration:**


	+ Provide system administration for all servers, network equipment, operating systems, and applications on the network.
	+ Ensure the stability and performance of the entire network infrastructure.
* **Vulnerability Mitigation:**


	+ Provide input and support for mitigating vulnerability findings from network security scans.
	+ Implement measures to enhance network security and resilience.
* **PKI/CAC Support and Maintenance:**


	+ Support and maintain DOD PKI/CAC requirements, including OCSP Software for authenticating PKI certificates.
	+ Manage PKI hardware and software, ensuring compliance with government regulations.
* **LAN and WAN Management:**


	+ Manage LAN and Wide Area Network (WAN) connectivity, guaranteeing Quality of Service (QoS) for various applications.
	+ Provide cost-effective solutions and recommendations for network optimization.
* **External Connectivity:**


	+ Ensure secure external connectivity through point-to-point links, Virtual Private Network (VPN) tunnels, remote access, and NIPRNet access.
	+ Take responsibility for the remote access VPN in alignment with authorized user requirements.
* **Daily Operations and Inspections:**


	+ Perform daily operations activities, including Syslog and Event log reviews, backup verification, and physical inspections of server rooms and equipment.
	+ Identify and report potential issues, mitigating risks with minimal impact on the production environment.
* **Monthly Maintenance:**


	+ Conduct pre-scheduled monthly maintenance on the DoD network environment.
	+ Notify network users in advance, ensuring minimal disruption during maintenance windows.

**Minimum Qualifications:*** Minimum of 6 years of experience in planning, designing, implementing and managing DoD networks
* Minimum of 6 years of experience in maintaining onsite network operations, applications and hardware
* DoD 8570 IAT Level 2 certification

**Desired Certifications:*** Security +
* CCNA, CCNP

**What We Offer:**


Pivot Path Solutions strives to attract, motivate, and retain the best people in the industry. Our benefits package reflects our continued commitment to our employees by prioritizing the health and well-being of each member. These benefits include:

* Medical Health Insurance
* Dental
* Vision
* 401(K)
* Life Insurance
* Short Term and Long-Term Disability
* Education Reimbursement
* Employee Referral Program


U.S. Citizenship is required for this specific opportunity and all selected applicants will be subject to a government security investigation. This includes but not limited to; meeting the eligibility requirements for access to classified information and the ability to obtain a government-granted security clearance. Individuals may also be subject to a background investigation including, but not limited to criminal history, employment verification, education verification, drug testing, and creditworthiness.

*Pivot Path Solutions, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or genetic information.*

title: Network Security Architect Entry Level Opportunity
description:
### **When you join Verizon**


Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We’re a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. We anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together—lifting up our communities and striving to make an impact to move the world forward. If you’re fueled by purpose, and powered by persistence, explore a career with us. Here, you’ll discover the rigor it takes to make a difference and the fulfillment that comes with living the #NetworkLife.

### **What you’ll be doing…**


From internships and co-ops to leadership development programs and entry-level roles, Verizon’s award-winning Campus program allows you to take the next step toward shaping your future. Our Campus program has been recognized with awards like WayUp’s Top 100 Internship Programs and RippleMatch’s Campus Forward Award. Why the accolades? It’s easy. We quickly immerse our early in career V Teamers in meaningful work that delivers tangible business impact. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to network with V Teamers across the globe, find mentors, and establish meaningful friendships that could last a lifetime. Start here and go anywhere, with opportunities across the business. When students like you join the V Team, our network becomes even stronger.


This position is for a Security Architect entry level role in the Verizon Global Network & Technology organization. In this role you will work to proactively engineer security controls to mitigate risk early in the development lifecycle. You will gather requirements, designs, codes, tests, implements, and support secure applications and solutions while maintaining knowledge of various programming languages, data analytics and automation tools. You will ensure scalability of emerging security technologies and solutions.


As a Security Architect you will:

* Analyze new networking solutions, identifying potential security concerns, recommending approaches that can be used to mitigate identified risks, and working with technology teams to implement recommendations.
* Implement security controls developed by the business to mitigate risk during the development lifecycle.
* Implement tools and programs developed by senior staff to improve the security analysis process within the business.
* Keep up to date on emerging security technologies and solutions.
* Provide client support, escalating consultation and information security subject matter expertise to senior members.
* Review provided requirements, design, code, test, implement, and support secure applications and solutions while maintaining knowledge of various programming languages, data analytics and automation tools.
* Work under supervision to implement security controls developed by the business to mitigate risk during the development lifecycle.


You must be currently enrolled in a degree program and be in good academic standing to be considered.


In this hybrid full time position, you’ll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager. This hybrid role will be based out of Cary, North Carolina.


 If you are interested in other roles and locations in addition to this one, please submit your application to those postings as well in order to be considered.

### **What we’re looking for...**


You’re a motivated self-starter. Never satisfied with the status quo, you’re always trying to perform at your personal best. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where new challenges come up every day. You are flexible, dependable, and work well in varying environments. Learning quickly is personally rewarding and inspires you to take smart risks.


You’ll need to have:

* Current enrollment in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree majoring in Telecommunications, Information Technology, Engineering, Data Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science or related majors with a completion date of June 2024.
* Coursework or experience with Threat modeling including Microsoft STRIDE and Mitre ATT&CK.
* Coursework or experience in Network & Security protocols (ex: TCP/IP).
* Coursework or experience in Cloud Infrastructure, Policies, & Standards, Security Configurations.
* Authorization to work in the U.S. without restrictions or need for future sponsorship.
* Willingness to travel and work in Cary, North Carolina.


Even better if you have one or more of the following:

* Demonstrated strong written and communication skills.
* Experience working with Microsoft Office and/or Google Suite.
* Ability to work with/in Cloud IAM, Authentication, and access control.
* Ability to work with/in Cloud Computing (AWS/Openshift/GCP/Azure).
* Ability to work with/in Network Performance.


If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every "even better" qualification listed above.

### **Where you’ll be working**


In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.### **Scheduled Weekly Hours**


40### **Equal Employment Opportunity**


We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees’ differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.

title: API Architect
description:
EV Connect is seeking an experienced, hands-on API Architect with 8+ years of design, prototyping and implementation experience. If you share our passion for electric mobility ecosystems, the environment and energy independence for future generations, please read on.  

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior API Architect to lead the charge in defining our next generation API-first architecture. This person will play a crucial role in creating and maintaining secured, scalable, highly responsive and robust API suites hosted in our cloud native environments. **As an API Architect, you'll contribute to the following activities:*** Work closely with Products on business use cases by providing technical expertise and supporting documentation.
* Own all aspects of our Integration Architecture (IA). Evaluate emerging technologies.
* Establish and document the full life cycle of API governance standards and best practices.
* Drive towards industry standards and RESTful services and identify appropriate integration approaches.
* Work with internal and external API consumers and service providers. Drive towards optimal integration agreements.
* Document the API landscape, identifying gaps and participate in roadmaps definition.
* Continuously monitor and improve API performance and utilization. Predict scaling needs and manage scaling operations effectively.
* Manage API gateways. Design and enforce API policies.
* Supervise partner facing API documentation as well as internal API documentation.
* Ensure designs and initiatives are in line with the overall corporate vision, strategies and goals.
* Train and mentor others on REST APIs, microservices, API Gateways, containers, and automation.

 **Required skills and experience:*** Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
* 8+ years of experience in API architecture and development, specifically with REST frameworks
* Experience in OAuth2, OIDC, TLS, mTLS, OpenAPI, Swagger, SAML, PKI and Digital Certificates
* Solid understanding of microservice architecture and containerization technologies
* Good knowledge of Integration/API life cycle & Methodology, API standards and style guides
* Strong Background in REST based API development
* Strong software engineering and SAAS background
* Strong knowledge in core AWS services like API Gateway, S3, EC2, EKS, Lambda, SNS, SQS, Cognito, DynamoDB or equivalence in Azure
* Solid experience with Spring Boot, Java JavaScript, React, React Native, WebSockets, MongoDB Atlas, ELK stack.
* Experience operating in an Agile delivery model.
* Experience with cloud-native applications and an understanding of design principles for scalability, performance, and reliability.
* Good understanding of event driven architectures
* Excellent problem-solving abilities and a performance-oriented mindset
* Should have excellent communication skills. Be a fast learner and proactive thinker.
* Ability to innovate, automate, and continually improve processes. Possess critical thinking and analytical skills.

 **Would be a plus:*** Electric Utility experience
* EV charging industry experience.
* Familiar with EV charging protocols like OCPP and OCPI
* Experience with ELK stack.
* Experience with New Relic and Grafana
* Software Development Kit (SDK) building experience

 **About EV Connect****:**
EV Connect is on a mission to build a better planet by enabling electricity as a transportation fuel. Through its innovative and open charging platform, EV Connect simplifies the set-up, management, and optimization of charging stations with premium customer service, from installation to driver support. EV Connect guides companies of all sizes in managing networks of chargers and delivers a seamless EV charging experience that empowers drivers.  

Established in 2010, EV Connect is a subsidiary of Schneider Electric which serves customers across the U.S., including GM, Avista Utilities, Love’s Travel Stops, Verizon, Marriott, Hilton, Western Digital, SCE, New York Power Authority, and numerous municipalities. Globally, EV Connect's reach extends across Europe, Australia, and Asia, removing carbon emissions from vehicles through the electrification of transportation.  

Named to the 2022 Times100 List of Most Influential Companies, the Company has been a perennial member of the Inc. 5000 growth list since 2020. For more information, please visit www.evconnect.com and follow us on Twitter and LinkedIn.  

EV Connect is an Equal Opportunity Employer and requires proof of eligibility to work in the U.S.

title: Enterprise Architect, Healthcare Systems & Technologies
description:
**This is where you save and sustain lives**

At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You’ll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.


Baxter’s products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.


Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.


Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives— where your purpose accelerates our mission.

**Your role at Baxter**
-----------------------

Nothing changes if nothing changes, which is why Baxter is transforming our global IT function—into one that will strengthen partnerships and enable smarter, more efficient and connected business processes. In the dynamic healthcare industry, we need to be ready to face new challenges and opportunities. As we learn, we must be agile and innovative to reveal new ways of working. Technology and our digital capability will help create a more efficient and innovative ecosystem to enable our employees, customers and products to drive better outcomes for patients worldwide.


We are at the critical intersection where robust IT infrastructure and networking support meets the physicians, nurses and care givers who save and sustain lives. Together, we can build upon Baxter’s rich heritage to advance the next generation of transformative healthcare innovations. Together, we can change how IT meets healthcare. Together, we are Baxter.


This is where technology fuels purpose-driven work. Where your purpose accelerates our mission.

**Your Team**
-------------


The Enterprise Architect proactively and holistically helps and guides the enterprise leaders, product managers, product owners and distributed product delivery teams through transformation and optimization initiatives, supporting the formulation of business strategy, outcomes and capabilities. Your scope of activities could include helping the organization achieve targeted business outcomes related to growing revenue, optimizing costs, mitigating risks and improving sustainability. You will be using techniques such as Tech Blueprinting, Capability Mapping, Benchmarking, and Research - develop overall Enterprise Architecture recommendations to align to Baxter EA standards and governance.

**What you'll be doing**
------------------------

* Through collaboration with Business Relationship Managers, and Manufacturing Relationship Managers align and optimize Healthcare Systems and Technologies (HST) business capabilities and processes to IT Strategy. Including gathering and managing demands from the HST segment, identifying segment priorities through EA Domains and value stream mapping to support key objectives, and establishing segment-level strategic blueprints for the future.
* Rationalization of existing technologies including the identification of opportunities for consolidation, cost-savings, and simplification, and management of actions to achieve.
* Support and follow policies and governance as aligned to technology risk and architecture.
* Maintain the alignment, integration, and coordination of architecture activities across different programs, projects and products as they evolve over time.
* Facilitate business and IT alignment, connecting strategy to execution, through a cohesive, encouraging, and consultative manner, driving the organization’s digital business strategies and balancing innovation and growth.
* Lead and facilitate interaction with business & IT leaders in a conversation over the risks and implications of product decisions to the line of business, business unit and greater enterprise.
* Develop and apply minimal viable architectures, which can include a set of standards, reference architecture patterns, principles, and guardrails, through the EA governance model, which is advised by the business strategy and corporate governance. Clarifies accountability and provides the focal point for agile, effective, and efficient decision making.
* Facilitates a cohesive relationship across architecture community, product management and product delivery teams by providing freedom-in-a-box for decision making, with the minimal viable architecture forming the boundaries of the box.
* Collaborate with delivery teams to ensure consistency with enterprise architecture, as well as to leverage shared technologies, tools and processes that impact speed to value and time to market.
* Collaborate with infrastructure teams to ensure consistency with the enterprise architecture, as well as to identify when it is vital to modify the enterprise architecture.
* Collaborate with global EA core team to ensure the application portfolio management data are up to date for the accountable EA domains.
* Handle the analysis of business and operating models, market trends and the technology industry to resolve their potential impact on the enterprise’s business strategy, direction, and architecture.
* Lead analysis of the business’ future-state capabilities and future (and current) IT environment to detect critical gaps and opportunities and recommend solutions for improvement to drive the business towards its targeted outcomes.
* Scan new technologies and the business ecosystem for major innovative technology and non-technology trends (trend spotting) bringing them forward for future consideration and proving out.

**What you'll bring**
---------------------

* Bachelor’s degree in related field required.
* 10+ years of architecture or equivalent experience.
* Experience working with technology vendors.
* Expertise in healthcare and connected technology solutions.
* Broad expertise in Infrastructure, Cloud and Network services
* Knowledge of business domains. Experience in architecture models.
* Experience implementing new technologies into enterprise environments.
* Knowledge of IT governance and operations.
* Enterprise Integration technologies and patterns.

*Baxter is committed to supporting the needs for flexibility in the workplace. We do so through our flexible workplace policy which includes a minimum of 3 days a week onsite. This policy provides the benefits of connecting and collaborating in-person in support of our Mission.*


We understand compensation is an important factor as you consider the next step in your career. At Baxter, we are committed to equitable pay for all employees, and we strive to be more transparent with our pay practices. The estimated base salary for this position is $112,000 to $154,000 annually. The estimated range is meant to reflect an anticipated salary range for the position. We may pay more or less than of the anticipated range based upon market data and other factors, all of which are subject to change. Individual pay is based on upon location, skills and expertise, experience, and other relevant factors. This position may also be eligible for discretionary bonuses. For questions about this, our pay philosophy, and available benefits, please speak to the recruiter if you decide to apply and are selected for an interview.


#LI-VF1


The successful candidate for this job may be required to verify that he or she has been vaccinated against COVID-19, subject to reasonable accommodations for individuals with medical conditions or religious beliefs that prevent vaccination, and in accordance with applicable law.

**Equal Employment Opportunity**


Baxter is an equal opportunity employer. Baxter evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.  

  

EEO is the Law  

EEO is the law - Poster Supplement  

Pay Transparency Policy

**Reasonable Accommodations**  

  

Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities globally. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please click on the link here and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice.

title: Sr. Solution Architect
description:
**Who We Are**
Insurity’s vision is all about empowerment. Empowering insurance organizations to quickly capitalize on new opportunities by delivering the world’s most configurable, cloud-native, easy-to-use, and intuitively analytical software. It’s also about empowering our team members through tools, training, teamwork, and professional development opportunities.

To talk the talk, we must walk the walk. We are the largest cloud-based insurance software provider for the Property & Casualty market, and we are trusted by 22 of the top 25 Property & Casualty insurance carriers and 7 of the top 10 MGAs in the U.S. today. That’s proof we walk the walk. While our product suites are some of the most compelling in the industry, it’s our team members who deliver the exceptional value and unrivaled industry expertise our customers appreciate from us.

Our team tells us over and over; working at Insurity offers you the opportunity to collaborate with and learn from some of the most creative and knowledgeable minds in insurance technology. You’ll feel welcomed even before you start your first day with us through our award-winning onboarding program.

Take the first step to joining our team by applying today and we look forward to seeing **#UatInsurity**.
**Insurity’s Next Senior Solution Architect**
The Senior Solution Architect is a trusted adviser and subject matter expert leading our client work, bringing both deep understanding of the business of insurance and the analytics that can drive success for our customers. In this role you will act as a translation layer between business and analytic modeling teams, and work with technical implementation teams to execute the approach. You will be responsible for presenting results to various levels of leadership and influence key decisions that have customer or enterprise impact. The Senior Solution Architect is an industry thought leader, understanding current industry issues and trends to leverage opportunities to bring advanced analytics solutions to our customers that will achieve their strategic goals.
**What Our Senior Solution Architect Will Do*** Partner with carriers to function as a trusted advisor, by understanding their business and developing a roadmap to leverage analytics opportunities to achieve our client’s strategic goals through a long-term engagement plan
* Develop long-term trusted relationships with executive / key client stakeholders
* Collaborate with the data science team to develop advanced predictive models and exploratory data analyses that will unveil key data insights
* Identify, drive, and lead solution-based initiatives supporting customers
* Be a key communicator of analytical results and insights to various collaborators across the company and customer base
* Support responsibility for the integration of data science, data engineering, and solution architect in support and execution of client strategic engagements

**Who We’re Looking For*** Professional experience in the property and casualty insurance industry
* Ability to work effectively with executive partners
* Customer advocacy and passion to educate and deliver value through analytics
* Expert ability to translate complex analyses and concepts to non-technical audiences within and outside of the organization
* Strong verbal communication skills across diverse set of roles including executives, managers, underwriters, actuaries, data scientists, IT, and Insurity team members
* Excellent written communication skills demonstrating the ability to create succinct, compelling audience-relevant documentation
* Key Abilities / Traits:
* Strong multi-tasking capabilities and ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
* Ability to collaborate and work autonomously
* Flexible and adaptable
* Relevant degree

**What’s In It For U*** **Flex First Workforce**: Do your work best from home or from one of our office locations; it’s your choice.
* **Generous Time Off**: Our leadership believes in taking the time you need when you need it through our Open PTO Policy.
* **Day One Health Benefits + Employer-Matched Retirement Savings**: You might think these are table stakes, but we know these matter to you.
* **More Than Just Core Values**: Our values are fundamental in how we attract, train, and retain top talent.
* **Award-Winning Onboarding Program**: We set you up from the get-go to make a significant impact from Day One and follow you through your entire first year.
* **Real Career Growth Opportunities**: We love to promote from within with over 20% of our open roles filled through internal applicants on average.
* **Mentorship Program:** We support a champion culture and growth mindset by pairing you with experienced, talented leaders to help you grow personally and professionally.
* **Internal Networking:** Build relationships, network, collaborate, and stay connected with colleagues internally with our one-of-a kind online *Coffee for Two* program.
* **Continuous Learning Opportunities**: Own your development with your own LinkedIn Learning and Kaplan licenses.
* **Discounted University Tuition**: Employees and their families can start or continue their university career with less out-of-pocket investment through our partnerships with the University of Arizona Global Campus.
* **Employee Referral Bonus**: Once you come onboard, give Insurity the biggest compliment you can give by referring someone to work here and earn a cash bonus.



We have five Core Values at Insurity; one of which is to ***Act with Integrity***. Providing pay transparency helps you make the best decision for you. We continuously analyze and update our salary ranges for our roles according to market trends to not only ensure our employees are paid fairly, but also help close gender, race, and disability wage gaps. Along with the benefits listed above, the salary range for this role is $86,000 - $165,000, commensurate with experience.
**Insurity is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer**
We are dedicated to creating an exceptional work environment for all our employees by extending a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging into the very fabric of our organization. We embrace differences and diversity of identity, experience, and thought, and actively strive for inclusive behaviors across our company.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application and/or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Thank you for your interest in Insurity! Please understand that due to the volume of applicants we receive, only selected candidates will be contacted.
**#LI-Remote**

title: Information Security Architect
description:
First Quality was founded in 1989 and has grown to be a global privately held company with over 4,000 employees. Its corporate offices are located in Great Neck, New York, with manufacturing facilities and offices in Pennsylvania, South Carolina, Georgia, and Canada. First Quality is a diversified family of companies manufacturing consumer products ranging from Absorbent Hygiene (adult incontinence, feminine care, and baby care), Tissue (bath and towel), and Industrial (print and packaging materials), serving institutional and retail markets throughout the world. First Quality focuses on private label and branded product lines.
We are seeking an Information Security Architect for our First Quality Enterprise working remotely from the Eastern Time Zone. This position provides leadership as well as in-depth expertise in all security aspects surrounding the implementation and operation of Information Technology solutions to improve the ability of the organization to protect the confidentiality, availability, and integrity of its information assets.
Primary responsibilities include:* Lead security architecture framework to be implemented across all IT and IS projects
* Provide security architecture design reviews for company-wide projects, setting security controls requirements and guidance to the project team.
* Create security design documents for on-going projects
* Provide technical guidance to the SOC team for security controls context and on-going efficiency
* Maintain awareness of industry methods and techniques for information security and Enterprise Architecture and make recommendations for their adoption where appropriate.
* Research emerging security technologies and conduct POCs (Proof Of Concept) projects with all relevant stakeholders (from both IT and IS teams)
* Investigate, recommend, and assist with implementing security solutions that provide detection, prevention, containment, and deterrence mechanisms to protect and maintain the integrity of data and network resources.
* Define security product requirements, conduct research, evaluation, testing, configuration, and implementation, to include identify management, access control, and intrusion prevention solutions.
* Provide technical guidance to the GRC team with assessing 3rd party vendors and supply chain.
* Provide technical guidance for periodic penetration tests conducted on different corporate systems.
* Perform detailed and routine assessment to ensure use of established security policies, practices and expectations across all platforms, operating systems, and applications.


The ideal candidate should possess the following:* Bachelors’ Degree or Equivalent Experience in Computer Science, EE, Data Network Security Architecture and Design.
* Minimum 5 years of experience running security solutions on network/security engineering/security operations.
* Knowledge of IT security controls - firewalls, SIEM platforms, NAC, CASB, DLP, IPS/IDS, encryption, authentication, tokenization, XDR/EDR tools and desktop virtualization security.
* Broad knowledge of network security practices, designs, methodologies, tools, and processes.
* Comprehensive knowledge of network architectures, equipment, and designs.
* Knowledge of computer/network forensics.
* Knowledge of vulnerability scanners and how to successfully implement and maintain an enterprise patching program.
* Security risk assessment skills.
* Ability to function in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment using persuasion, expertise, and judgment to affect change.
* Self-motivated with the ability to move multiple projects forward at one time.
* Willingness to work on improving your security knowledge for the areas that are currently not your strength.
* Discretion and sensitivity requiring absolute confidentiality.
* Strong attention to detail and follow through skills.
* Some travel via car or air to company locations required, which may require overnight stays.


Estimated annual base salary range for this position is $130,000 - $180,000.
Base pay is only part of our total compensation package, which also includes an attractive annual discretionary bonus and robust suite of employee benefits for which you are eligible to participate in starting on your first day of employment.
Base pay offered will be determined on an individualized basis and we will consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.*First Quality is committed to protecting information under the care of First Quality Enterprises commensurate with leading industry standards and applicable regulations. As such, First Quality provides at least annual training regarding data privacy and security to employees who, as a result of their role specifications, may come in to contact with sensitive data.**First Quality is an Equal* *Opportunity* *employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identification, or protected Veteran status.*

title: Network Architect- Remote
description:
**INFRASTRUCTURE NETWORK ARCHITECT - Remote**

**Duration - 12 Months**

**Description:**

**100% Remote: Monday through Friday, 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM . 35 Hours Work week.** 

**FIM (Foundational Infrastructure Modernization) Network Architect –**

**SCOPE OF SERVICES: Network – Routing and Switching: design, and implementation**

**TASKS:**

* Participate in design meetings and reviews from a Network perspective on assigned projects.
* Implement networking solution to meet the business requirements and at the same time meet OTI’s Best practices guidelines.
* Collaborate with OTI’s Architect teams for developing operable solutions for Citywide requirements.
* Lead build for installing new network devices.
* Follow OTI process for new devices commissioning.
* Configure ports, configure new switches, and apply the base templates configurations, integrate the switch into production network.
* Develop and validate base configurations for operational use.
* All tasks to follow OTI’s standard procedures.
* Open TAC cases as needed and fix root causes related to the project deployments.
* Review and implement, network resilience and network failover validations as directed.
* Implement and integrate for complex network upgrades and implementations.
* Complete any additional tasks assigned by the manager.

**MANDATORY SKILLS/EXPERIENCE** 

* Minimum 12 years of experience in the field of networking. - **A MUST**
* Must have hands-on experience with **BGP, MPLS, OSPF, IS-IS routing protocols in a large environment.**
* Deep understanding on virtualization, load balancing and hyperconverged infrastructure.

**DESIRABLE SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:**

* Hands on experience in **Cisco’s ACI technology**
* Additional experience in the field of load balancing.
* Good project management skills
* Ability to simultaneously work on multiple project tasks

Job Type: Contract

Experience level:

* 11+ years
* 7 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Network Architect
description:
Vacaville
,
California
Infrastructure/Networking/Solutions Architecture
Remote Work Option:
Yes
Job ID:
347144
Employment Type:
Contract
Pay Rate:
Base Salary:
$
80.00
/hr
  
### **ABOUT THIS FEATURED OPPORTUNITY**


Our client is searching for an Enterprise Network Solutions Architect to elevate their infrastructure. This key position will be responsible for spearheading network solutions at an enterprise level, specializing in areas like LAN, WAN, Wireless, Security, VoIP, Video, and Data Centers. You will have the chance to work closely with a dynamic team, manage high-profile projects, and contribute to mentoring and skill enhancement initiatives within the company.


### **THE OPPORTUNITY FOR YOU**


* Oversee the planning, design, implementation, and operation of network infrastructure projects.
* Serve as both a technical and communication manager for network projects.
* Provide technical assistance, on-site and remote, to team members and customers.
* Build and document infrastructure environments while following best practices and security policies.
* Offer technical guidance, knowledge transfer, and mentorship to internal peers.
* Monitor and troubleshoot network performance, ensuring optimization and security.
* Provide 24/7 support and report network operational status.
* Collaborate cross-functionally to ensure timely solution delivery.

### **KEY SUCCESS FACTORS**


* Expertise in Palo Alto Network Firewall, Prisma Cloud, and Cisco ASA.
* Strong understanding of OSI layers 2 and 3, including various protocols and methodologies.
* Proficiency in routing protocols like BGP, OSPF, EIGRP.
* Experience with network admin and monitoring tools such as Rancid, OpenNMS, Nagios, etc.
* Strong administrative scripting skills (Perl, UNIX shell scripting).
* Solid understanding of data center technology and colocation environments.

### **PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**


* Knowledge or experience in wireless network deployment.
* Working knowledge of AWS services.

title: Customer Engineer (Solution Architect) - Remote
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled, motivated, and customer-focused Customer Engineer to join our team. As a Customer Engineer, you will be responsible for providing technical expertise, support, and guidance to our valued customers. Your primary goal will be to ensure customer satisfaction by delivering excellent service, troubleshooting complex technical issues, and implementing effective solutions. You will also play a crucial role in driving revenue growth by providing technical expertise and support throughout the sales process. You will collaborate closely with the sales team and engage with prospective customers to understand their needs, present solutions, and demonstrate the value of our products or services. This position requires strong technical acumen, excellent communication skills, the ability to effectively articulate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences, and a passion for delivering exceptional customer experiences.

  

Requirements:
  

* Bachelor's degree in a relevant technical field (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering) or equivalent practical experience.
* 5+ years of relevant work experience (Network/Security/Pre Sales Engineering) - must
* Currently located in the US Central, Mountain or Pacific time zone - must
* Strong technical background with Proven experience as Customer Engineer or in a pre-sales / technical sales role, preferably in the information security industry.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to diverse audiences.
* Demonstrated ability to build rapport and establish relationships with customers, understanding their needs and providing tailored solutions.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to think critically and develop innovative solutions.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Willingness to travel to customer sites and industry events as needed.

  

Responsibilities:
  

* Collaborate with the sales team to identify and qualify potential customers, and actively participate in the sales process from discovery to closing deals.
* Conduct product demonstrations and deliver compelling presentations that effectively showcase our products or services' features, benefits, and value propositions.
* Understand customer requirements and business challenges, and develop innovative solutions tailored to their specific needs.
* Provide technical expertise and guidance to customers, addressing their questions, concerns, and objections during the pre-sales phase.
* Prepare and deliver technical proposals, solution designs, and product specifications that meet customer requirements and align with industry best practices.
* Collaborate with the product development and engineering teams to provide feedback on product enhancements, identify opportunities for improvement, and stay updated on the latest product releases and updates.
* Conduct proof-of-concept (POC) activities to demonstrate the feasibility and effectiveness of our solutions, ensuring customer satisfaction and building trust.
* Stay current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitive landscape to effectively position our products or services against competitors.
* Attend industry events, conferences, and trade shows to represent the company and actively engage with potential customers.

title: Network Operations Center Specialist
description:
Embark on a journey where professionalism and a laid-back work environment join forces as our newest Network Operations Center Specialist!

Frontline Managed Services® stands as a pioneer in IT, Financial, and Administrative Managed Services for legal and professional service firms. Our dedication to innovation, technology, and efficiency sets us apart in the industry. Our team is expanding and we are looking for new team members who are energetic, charismatic, and self-driven. We are seeking a talented and motivated individual to join our dynamic team as a Network Operations Center (NOC) Specialist. As a key player in our continental and global NOC teams, you'll contribute to the seamless operation of our clients' extensive networks, ensuring peak performance and security.

**Position Overview:**

As an NOC Specialist, you will be the escalation point of contact for client queries, providing second-level service through our ServiceNow platform. Joining our 24x7 infrastructure surveillance team, you'll play a crucial role in ensuring maximum service availability and performance for our Managed Infrastructure Services. Your responsibilities will include network provisioning, troubleshooting, and collaborating across various departments.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Network Monitoring and Maintenance:**Utilize advanced monitoring platforms (e.g., SolarWinds, LogicMonitor) to monitor and maintain large-scale networks.

Implement firmware and Windows patching to enhance network security and performance.

* **Security and Configuration:**Architect and configure MPLS, SD-WAN, client VPN, and site-to-site VPN solutions.

Manage and optimize Azure cloud platform services.

* **Collaboration and Troubleshooting:**Collaborate with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot and resolve network issues promptly.

Utilize ServiceNow for incident tracking, resolution, and documentation.

* **Documentation and Knowledge Base:**Contribute actively to the client knowledge base, documenting processes and procedures.

Provide technical expertise in Cisco and Fortinet technologies.

* **Strategic Contributions:**Contribute to the development and execution of network strategies.

Participate in 24x7 shifts and support call-out rota if required.

**Skills and Qualifications:**

* **Certifications:**Cisco CCNA and Fortinet NSE4 certifications are required.
* **Technical Proficiency:**Proficiency in Nimble and VNXe SAN technologies.

Proven experience with Azure cloud platform services.  
Familiarity with monitoring platforms (SolarWinds, LogicMonitor).

* **Networking Expertise:**Hands-on experience with firmware and Windows patching.

Proficiency in architecting and configuring MPLS, SD-WAN, client VPN, and site-to-site VPN.  
Knowledge of network topologies, standards, and infrastructure.

* **Communication and Collaboration:**Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Previous experience in a NOC environment, monitoring and troubleshooting various network services.

* **Team Skills:**Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.

Commitment to diversity and inclusion.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Life insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: Remote

title: IT Network Systems Engineer, IS Enterprise Services, Work from Home
description:
Responsibilities:

The IT Network Systems Engineer will be responsible for supporting and optimizing Norton Healthcare's technical infrastructure and will seek improvements on a continuous basis, utilizing Norton Healthcare's technology standards including security, hardware, software, databases, desktop, network, server, storage and peripherals. The IT Network Systems Engineer will be considered the Subject Matter Expert (SME) in either Wireless, Data Center Networking, or Campus Routing & Switching, and having responsibility for this technology component in the Norton Enterprise. The IT Network Systems Engineer will also provide reports on the overall status and health of the specific network technologies, enabling leadership to make data-driven decisions regarding the infrastructure. While the IT Network Systems Engineer will be considered an SME in the specific technology, the Engineer is expected to be knowledgeable in the other networking technology areas, in order to offer insight and direction with engineering peers. This role will work closely with the other IS technology teams to ensure new products and standards will meet organizational goals and follow best practices for the networking technology stack. This role is expected to assist Security, Operations and Application teams in system rollouts to ensure the design, installation, configuration, business continuity / disaster recovery planning and documentation are accurately deployed and maintained. This role is responsible to maintain existing infrastructure to ensure hardware, firmware and software versions are kept up to date. Assist in leading organizational projects and initiatives to adhere to NHC standards and industry best practices, executing the plan to ensure the compatibility and integration for systems, and assists in managing the rollout of these initiatives from infancy to fruition ensuring all systems adhere to the highest standards. The individual will work with NHC IS architects and leadership to implement best practices, policies, and security standards for the organization that are highly available and are optimized for performance.  

\\*\\***This position has the opportunity to work from home. You may be asked to complete training at a Norton Healthcare facility or be able to come to a Norton Healthcare facility for business purposes. Employees in this role must reside in Kentucky or Indiana\\*\\***

**Required:*** With Bachelor's degree: 7 years of experience in Information Technology
* Without Bachelor's degree: 10 years of experience in Information Technology

title: NOC Engineer
description:
**About Command|Link**  
Command|Link is a global SaaS Platform providing network, voice services, and IT security solutions, helping corporations consolidate their core infrastructure into a single vendor and layering on a proprietary single pane of glass platform. Command|Link has revolutionized the IT industry by tackling the problems our competitors create. In recognition for our unprecedented innovation and dedication, Command|Link was recognized as the SD-WAN Product of the Year, ITSM Visionary Spotlight, UCaaS Product of the Year, NaaS Product of the Year, Supplier of the Year, and the AT&T Strategic Growth Partner. Command|Link has built the only IT platform for scale that solves ISP vendor sprawl and IT headaches. We make it easy for our customers to get more done, maximize uptime and improve the bottom line.

Learn more about us here!  
**About your new role:**  
The NOC Engineer is responsible for supporting new and existing ISP/MSP business customers. You will work on supporting business data circuits, SDWAN Networks, VoIP services, VPNs, Managed Routers, Firewalls, and you will learn, design and deliver various custom-managed services.

No travel to customer locations is required.  
**Key Responsibilities:**

* Working with customers to resolve any service problems: SDWAN, Internet,
* Understanding of basic LAN configurations (Routers / Firewalls) and Microsoft operation systems
* Handling new customer-managed service provisioning support functions Interfacing with vendors to resolve support issues
* Owning support issues from start to finish

Keeping customers happy with superior support and a level head\\* -going the extra mile

* Train and assist other engineers with complex issues

**What you'll need for success:**

* High School Diploma or GED Equivalent
* 3-5 years of related experience working in a fast-paced environment
* CCNA and CCNP certification is desirable
* Command line experience with Cisco, Fortinet, Juniper
* Firewall configuration experience (e.g. Fortinet)
* Understanding and experience with BGP, OSPF, and VRRP
* Experience with basic routers/firewalls and NAT (Network Address Translation)
* Experience with COS/QOS
* Experience with designing networks
* SOC2 knowledge and understanding
* Excellent organization skills and attention to detail
* Ability to multi-task assignments and follow process flow are required
* Must have excellent communication and analytical skills to understand and resolve customer issues effectively. This would include being comfortable talking with Clients.
* Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

**Why you'll love life at Command|Link**

Join us at CommandLink, where you'll have the opportunity to shape the future of business communication. We value the innovative spirit and seek individuals ready to bring their unique vision and expertise to a team that values bold ideas and strategic thinking. Are you ready to make an impact? Apply now and be the architect of your career as well as our clients' success.

* Room to grow at a high-growth company
* An environment that celebrates ideas and innovation
* Your work will have a tangible impact
* Generous Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage for full-time employees
* Flexible time off
* 401k to help you save for the future
* Fun events at cool locations
* Free DoorDash lunches on Fridays
* Employee referral bonuses to encourage the addition of great new people to the team

title: Network Architect
description:
Hi,

Greetings from Zllius Inc!

We have an urgent opening for the role**Network Architect.** If interested, revert me back with your Updated resume, along with contact details, work authorization.

**Job Role: Network Architect**

**Location: Harrisburg area (Hybrid)**

**Duration: Long-term**

**Position: W2/1099**

**Visa: Any (Except H1B)**

**Job Ref: AUG80**

**Responsibilities and Duties**

* Design and develop network architectures for on premise datacenters, cloud (public and private)
* Prepare and deliver training, documentation and network awareness activities to the Network Engineering and Operations teams
* Develop technical solutions to help mitigate observed gaps in current connectivity solutions and hardware platforms
* Align to widely accepted networking standards and frameworks with overall business and technology strategy
* Adapt networking architecture elements to adapt to new standards as they emerge
* Identify design gaps in existing and proposed networking architectures and recommend changes or enhancements
* Possess a firm understanding of the interconnectivity within and to VMware, Amazon Web Services (AWS) and the Microsoft Azure platforms

This includes but is not limited to multi-datacenter interconnectivity, WAN solutions based on carrier MPLS along with Internet-based DMVPN via all manner of Internet connection types
* Familiarity with public and private cloud connectivity technologies.
* Proven experience in design and operation of diverse enterprise networks

* Strong hands-on technical abilities and attention to detail

* Ability to conduct repetitive tasks on a computer, utilizing a mouse, keyboard, and monitor

**Zllius Inc.**
